intro: Melandrium morrisonmontanum, commonly known as the Morrison Mountains catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the high elevations of the Morrison Mountains in Colorado. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun conditions. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
